study.title: Guess the Language!
study.body: Different programming languages have unique syntax and use cases. In this section, you'll identify which language a given code snippet belongs to.

study.title: Fix the Code!
study.body: Debugging is an essential skill in programming. In this section, you'll identify the problem in a given code snippet.

study.title: Complete the Code!
study.body: Fill in the blank questions test your understanding of programming syntax and logic. Choose the correct code to complete the snippet.

study.title: Synomyms!
study.body: Synonyms are words that have the same or nearly the same meaning as another word. For example, 'happy' and 'joyful' are synonyms because they both express a positive feeling.

study.title: Antomyms!
study.body: Antonyms are words that have opposite meanings. For example, 'hot' and 'cold' are antonyms because they express opposite temperatures.

study.title: Find the Word!
study.body: Fill in the blank questions test your vocabulary and understanding of word usage. Choose the correct word to complete the sentence.

study.title: Add & Subtract!
study.body: Lorem, ipsum dolor sit amet consectetur adipisicing elit. Incidunt inventore ad tempore corrupti aliquid optio sint reprehenderit culpa asperiores. study.title: Multiply & Divide!
study.body: Multiplication and division are fundamental operations in mathematics. Multiplication is repeated addition, while division is the process of splitting a number into equal parts. Understanding these concepts is essential for solving more complex problems.

study.title: Squares & Roots!
study.body: Squaring a number means multiplying it by itself, while finding the square root is the inverse operation. These concepts are widely used in geometry, algebra, and advanced mathematics.
